New Records: Giannis Antetokounmpo's first triple-double of the season with 11 points, 12 rebounds, and 13 assists
Key Match Events: Raptors fell behind by 13 in the first quarter, down by 19 at halftime, and were playing their G League lineup midway through the fourth
Raptors' Scottie Barnes picked Giannis Antetokounmpo's pocket at halfcourt and went the length of the floor for a windmill dunk
Antetokounmpo took only eight shots and scored just 11 points, the first time he’s been held below 20 points this season
Pre-Game Insights: The Raptors were finally whole again with all their preferred starters and bench options available
The Bucks were struggling to stay above.500 and not waste the remaining prime of Giannis Antetokounmpo’s career
Post-Match Reflections: RJ Barrett called on himself, Scottie Barnes, and Immanuel Quickley to lead the team back in the right direction
Raptors head coach Darko Rajakovic admitted that his team didn’t bring enough fight and didn’t do a good enough job of closing out on the three-point line
Miscellaneous Highlights: Former Raptor Gary Trent Jr. looked comfortable on the Scotiabank Arena floor, finishing with 17 points on 6-of-9 shooting
Bucks rookie centre Liam Robbins is Erin Devlin's nephew and played professionally in Toronto for the first time
Others: The Raptors have lost 12 of their past 13 games, several of them in historically inept fashion
The team will visit New York, Cleveland, and Detroit on a three-game road trip
